Hereford ISD employees have been diligently working this last week preparing for alternative learning opportunities to begin Monday March 30, 2020. Just as teachers have prepared, we know students will need time to make adjustments as well. This week teachers will be using activities to encourage and instruct students on the use of the alternative learning platform. Teachers, if they have not already, will be contacting your child regarding the activity that has been planned for them. A variety of platforms will be used such as Google Classroom, Edgenuity, Class Dojo, Zoom, Schoology, E-learning and others to deliver instruction to your child.

If you have questions at any time you may email your child’s teacher or campus administrator for assistance.

Please remember to visit the Hereford ISD and click on COVID-19 for frequently asked questions (FAQ’s) and updates.

Thank you all for your continued patience as we navigate this new system of learning. Please continue to pray for our community, our state and our nation.

The Board recognized bus drivers Esther Aquillon, Salvador Orozco, as well as bus aide Eulalia Rodriguez and HISD school nurse Cynthia Rodriguez.
The four employees were recognized after two recent traffic accidents, Jan. 22 and Feb. 4 involving HISD school buses.
No HISD students or staff members were injured in the accidents, and HISD Superintendent Sheri Blankenship took the time to thank both drivers, the bus aide as well as the school nurse for taking care of Hereford ISD students. Both Hereford bus drivers were not at fault for the accidents, and following each accident, all students on the buses were examined by the school nurse for injuries.

post_text: The Hereford Independent School District Board of Trustees met on Wednesday May 8, 2019 to discuss and consider the Guaranteed Maximum Price(GMP) from Southwest General Contractors for phase 1 of the 2018 Bond. Phase 1 work will include safe and secure entrances for HHS/CTE and West Central. The construction cost of this phase is set for $1, 316, 602.00. Hereford ISD Board of Trustees approved the GMP. Southwest General Contractors is expected to start work Tuesday May 28, 2019.
